results.idea: Earnings momentum: recent analyst EPS actual change
results.description: S1: used multiple fields? Yes (anl4_af_eps_value). S2: vector fields not identified, not applied. S3: coverage of anl4_af_eps_value = 0.9956 (>0.6) so ts_backfill not needed. S4: field has moderate user/alpha counts; relied on high-coverage actual EPS. Kept implementation concise and <=7 operators & <=2 datafields. Confidence set to 0.75 based on signal intuitiveness and data quality.

results.idea: Estimate surprise vs consensus: reported EBIT vs mean estimate
results.description: S1: combined reported value and mean estimate. S2: no vector fields. S3: both fields coverage >0.6 so no ts_backfill. S4: used anl4_ebit_value (coverage 0.9483, high user/alpha counts) and est_ebit (0.7309). Kept implementation short. Confidence 0.80 due to strong fundamental surprise signal.

results.idea: Rising analyst conviction: increase in number of EPS estimates
results.description: S1: used two fields (anl4_qf_az_eps_number). S2: field is scalar; S2 not applied. S3: coverage = 0.7848 (>0.6) so no backfill. S4: high userCount/alphaCount for estimate counts. Implementation respects operator/datafield limits. Confidence 0.65 — moderate.

results.idea: Estimate dispersion: sales estimate stddev predicts volatility
results.description: S1: used sales_estimate_stddev_quarterly with est_sales. S2: no vector field. S3: coverage sales stddev = 0.7259 (>0.6), est_sales = 0.7458, no backfill. S4: user/alpha counts reasonable. Kept short. Confidence 0.6 - exploratory.

results.idea: Upgrade signal: increase in number of 'buy' recommendations
results.description: S1: single field anl4_buy (recommendation count) used; S1 partially applied (single main field plus ts). S2: not a vector. S3: coverage 0.6243 (>0.6) so no ts_backfill. S4: moderate userCount. Implementation concise. Confidence 0.55 — weak-to-moderate.

results.idea: Broker consensus shift: median EPS estimate change
results.description: S1: combined anl4_afv4_median_eps and anl4_qfv4_eps_mean to capture consensus shift. S2: no vector. S3: both coverage =1.0 and 0.7848 => no backfill. S4: used median and mean for robustness. Implementation kept <=2 datafields. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Cash flow revision momentum: CFO estimate delta
results.description: S1: used anl4_cfo_number and anl4_cfo_high? Actually used anl4_cfo_number and anl4_cfo_high would be two fields; selected anl4_cfo_number and anl4_cfo_high. S2: not vector. S3: coverage anl4_cfo_number = 0.6232 (>0.6), anl4_cfo_high = 0.6232 so no backfill. S4: decent user counts. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: High-quality surprise filter: scale EBIT surprise cross-sectionally
results.description: S1: used anl4_ebit_value and est_ebit to compute surprise then zscore. S2: no vectors. S3: both high coverage, no backfill. S4: fields have high alphaCount; applied. Confidence 0.82.

results.idea: Persistent estimate revisions: long-term ts_ir of EPS changes
results.description: S1: used anl4_epsr_value (EPS actual) as primary. S2: not vector. S3: coverage 0.9904 so no backfill. S4: high user/alpha counts. Implementation uses ts_ir to measure information ratio of returns of revisions. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Earnings quality: EBITDA reported vs mean forecast
results.description: S1: combined anl4_ebitda_value and anl4_ebitda_mean. S2: not vector. S3: coverages 0.8133 and 0.5831; for anl4_ebitda_mean (0.5831<0.6) applied ts_backfill to preprocess. S4: high alphaCount for reported EBITDA. Confidence 0.72.

results.idea: Estimate acceleration: second derivative of EPS estimates
results.description: S1: used anl4_epsr_value; S2: no vector. S3: coverage >0.6 so no backfill. S4: used high coverage actual EPS. Kept operator count low. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Cash conversion improvement: reported CFO vs expected FCF
results.description: S1: used anl4_cfo_high and est_fcf. S2: non-vector. S3: est_fcf coverage 0.5777 (<0.6) so applied ts_backfill(est_fcf,60). anl4_cfo_high coverage ok. S4: used fields with reasonable counts. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Consensus divergence: reported netprofit vs analysts' mean

results.description: S1: anl4_tbvps_mean and anl4_tbvps_median used. S2: scalars. S3: coverage TBV fields ~0.33 <0.6 so applied ts_backfill to both. S4: low coverage reduces confidence. Confidence 0.4.

results.idea: Information-rich analysts: high historical ts_ir of their estimates
results.description: S1: anl4_basicconqfv110_mean used in ts_ir to find informative consensus. S2: single field. S3: coverage >0.7. S4: favors names with consistent analyst signals. Confidence 0.65.

results.idea: Earnings quality: adjusted net income vs reported net income
results.description: S1: used anl4_netprofita_value (adjusted) and net_profit_reported_value. S2: scalars. S3: net_profit_reported coverage 1.0; adjusted coverage 0.9312>0.6. S4: divergence may indicate one-time items. Confidence 0.6.

results.idea: Recent analyst-preest changes predict subsequent beats
results.description: S1: anl4_dez1afv4_est and anl4_dez1afv4_preest difference used. S2: scalars. S3: coverages 0.967 both >0.6. S4: detects recent revisions before reported results. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Momentum in reported EBITDA per share
results.description: S1: anl4_ebitda_value ts_delta used. S2: single field. S3: coverage 0.8133>0.6. S4: simple momentum on reported operating cash proxies. Confidence 0.64.

results.idea: Strong sales beats concentrated in few firms: high surprise, low numest
results.description: S1: actual_sales_value_annual, sales_estimate_count. S2: scalars. S3: sales_estimate_count coverage 1.0. S4: filters concentrated beats. Confidence 0.63.

results.idea: Earnings surprise momentum adjusted by past surprise volatility
results.description: S1: anl4_af_eps_value and ts_std_dev of past surprises. S2: scalars. S3: any low-coverage stddev fields backfilled. S4: normalizes by volatility. Confidence 0.68.

results.idea: Sustained upward revisions in free cash flow indicating structural improvement
results.description: S1: ts_zscore(ts_delta(est_fcf, 180), 360). S2: single field est_fcf. S3: est_fcf coverage 0.5777 <0.6 so applied ts_backfill. S4: long-horizon signal. Confidence 0.55.

results.idea: Strong quarter with increasing analyst coverage: beat * coverage growth
results.description: S1: combine anl4_af_eps_value surprise with ts_delta(earnings_per_share_estimate_count). S2: two fields. S3: coverage high for both. S4: accounts for both surprise and rising attention. Confidence 0.7.

results.idea: Operating cashflow beat with low financing outflows (quality of cash)
results.description: S1: operating_cashflow_reported_value and financing_cashflow_reported_value. S2: scalars. S3: financing cashflow coverage 0.4781<0.6 -> ts_backfill applied. S4: identifies quality cashflow. Confidence 0.57.

results.idea: Large EBITDA surprise among firms with falling debt
results.description: S1: anl4_ebitda_value and net_debt_actual_value. S2: scalars. S3: net_debt_actual_value coverage 0.3883 <0.6 so ts_backfill applied. S4: combine profitability and deleveraging. Confidence 0.52.

results.idea: Consensus upgrade signal: ts_quantile of recent estimate increases
results.description: S1: applied ts_quantile(ts_delta(anl4_qf_az_eps_mean,30), 60). S2: single field. S3: field coverage high. S4: quantile transforms for cross-sectional comparability. Confidence 0.66.

results.idea: Earnings beat but increasing goodwill (possible one-offs)
results.description: S1: anl4_af_eps_value and total_goodwill_actual_value. S2: scalars. S3: total_goodwill_actual_value coverage 0.3761<0.6 so ts_backfill applied. S4: flags low-quality beats. Confidence 0.46.
